name: Honey Chipotle Chicken Skewers
description: Chicken skewers that are very easy, deliciously smoky, nice and sweet, with lots of spice and bite. Air fryer, grill, and oven-friendly!
ingredients: 1 pound chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
2 tablespoons taco seasoning (I like the Siete brand)
1 orange, zest and juice (1–2 teaspoons zest and 1 tablespoon juice)
instructions: Soak: Soak the skewers in water for 15-30 minutes while you prep the chicken. Mix: Using your hands or tongs, mix the chicken with the honey chipotle mix. It’ll look saucy and messy, in a good way. Skewers: Thread the chicken pieces onto skewers (usually I get 4 skewers with a pound of chicken). Cook Em Up: You can cook these a number of different ways – I air fry them at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees. Grilling would also be amazing! Finish with a drizzle of honey, or (yum) 2 tablespoons of melted butter mixed with honey. It’s so good!
